intro: Cacalia farfarifolia, commonly known as the common bluebell, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces showy blue to purple flowers that bloom in early spring. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and arranged alternately along the stem. Cacalia farfarifolia is often found in meadows, woodlands, and along roadsides, thriving in well-drained soils.
